Université Paris Cité: Paris Cité University (French: Université Paris Cité) is a public research university located in Paris, France. It was created by decree on 20 March 2019, resulting from the merger of Paris Descartes (Paris V) and Paris Diderot (Paris VII) universities, established following the division of the University of Paris in 1970.[2] It was originally established as the University of Paris (French: Université de Paris), but was renamed by decree in March 2022 to its current name.[3] The university headquarter is located in the 6th arrondissement at boulevard Saint-Germain.
